refnamediv.refpurpose: Inform a UDDI server that the authentication token can be discarded.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The uddi_discard_authToken message is used to tell a UDDI-enabled server that the authentication token can be discarded. Subsequent calls that use the same authToken may be rejected. This message is optional for UDDI-enabled servers that do not manage session state or that do not support the get_authToken message.

refsect2.title: authInfo
refsect2.para: This required argument is an element that contains an authentication token. Authentication tokens are obtained using the get_authToken message.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: Upon successful completion, the server returns a dispositionReport is returned with a single success indicator. Discarding an expired authToken will be reported as a success condition.

refsect1.title: Errors
refsect1.para: If an error occurs in processing this message, a dispositionReport structure will be returned to the caller in a SOAP Fault. The following error information will be relevant:

row.entry: signifies that the authentication token value passed in the authInfo argument is either missing or is not valid.
